description.narrative: The strategic partnership project aims to contribute to achieving a result where all South Sudanese especially women and youth affected by conflict and fragility enjoy individual and community security. The long term outcome defined in the project is to ensure that Security Sector Reforms defined in the peace agreement take into account individual and community security concerns of all South Sudanese in a gender -sensitive manner. Two sub sets of targeted outcomes are clearly defined in the project to achieve the above long term outcome and project impact; a) Capacity strengthening of South Sudanese civil society organisation, b) Policy change through influencing and advocacy. An intended policy change is to ensure that the, implementation of a strategic security assessment, security policy framework, revised defence policy and roadmap for the unification of the army and security forces is based on individual and communities' actual needs and reflects realities at community levels. Focus will primarily be at national level, but also take into consideration the implementation of the peace agreement at local levels. In particular, influencing and advocacy initiatives will focus on the issue of small arms proliferation Sexual and Gender Based Violence (SGBV), high levels of impunity and the presence of local armed groups. The intended change is that these inter -related issues are better taken into account, in particular, the way in which they affect individual and community security, in the design of security sector reforms. Pathway to policy change and CS strengthening. During the first year of implementation the main influencing target will be the work of the Strategic Defence and Security Review Board in order to influence their assessment of security matters in South Sudan as well as the roadmap that will be developed for SSR. In the subsequent years, when this has been completed, pending on the outcome of the assessments and the roadmap, policy influencing
